## Experience Every Detail

Step inside **1822 Pine Street** through our comprehensive visual collection. Each image captures the careful balance of **historic preservation** and **modern luxury** that defines The Rittenhouse Residence—from the original 1854 checkerboard marble floors to the panoramic city views from our roof deck.

## Historical Documents Collection
*Original Artifacts from 1854-1915*

### Key Historical Events

::: {.timeline-gallery}

<div class="timeline-item">
<img src="images/documents/1854 Deed abstract (2)_web.jpg" alt="1854 original deed from John McCrea to John Roset">
<div>
<h4>1854: The Beginning</h4>
<p>Original deed when builder John McCrea sold the newly constructed house to John Roset, establishing 170 years of continuous residential use.</p>
<span class="seo-caption">This original 1854 deed marks the birth of one of Rittenhouse Square's most significant historic properties.</span>
</div>
</div>

<div class="timeline-item">
<img src="images/documents/1899 Deed abstract - 1_web.jpg" alt="1899 deed showing Agnes Spencer's inheritance">
<div>
<h4>1899: The Grand Renovation</h4>
<p>Agnes Spencer inherits the property and commissions prestigious architects Duhring, Okie & Ziegler for a complete modernization, creating the elegant spaces we see today.</p>
<span class="seo-caption">The 1899 renovation transformed 1822 Pine into one of Philadelphia's finest examples of turn-of-the-century architecture.</span>
</div>
</div>

:::

## Virtual Tour Features

### What You'll Experience:

**Entry Level & Parlors**
- Original 1854 marble threshold worn smooth by 170 years of footsteps
- Double parlors where suffragette meetings shaped women's rights
- 14-foot ceilings with original plaster medallions
- Pocket doors with functioning 1854 hardware

**Bedroom Suites**
- 8 distinct bedrooms across 5 private suites
- Mix of king and queen beds with luxury linens
- Original fireplaces (decorative) in principal rooms
- Period-appropriate furnishings throughout

**Modern Amenities**
- High-speed WiFi (351 Mbps) throughout all floors
- 70-inch 4K smart TVs with Netflix
- Central air conditioning and heating
- Two full kitchens with professional equipment
- In-unit washer and dryer

**Historic Preservation**
- 1899 Duhring, Okie & Ziegler architectural elements intact
- Original hardwood floors throughout
- Marble mantels in all principal rooms
- Stained glass transoms and period lighting
